content: mad eye patch materials size 4 hook small amounts worsted weight black blue white i used paton s classic merino 50 yds estimate light brown tapestry needle small amount of fiberfill two buttons elastic about 6 inches this pattern is made up of 4 pieces the eyeball part the socket part and two straps here is a picture of all 4 completed parts before being pieced together eyeball * pattern is worked in the round each round begins with chain 1 and ends with slip_stitch in first single_crochet of round to join round 1 black chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook slip_stitch fasten_off round 2 blue attach blue at first single_crochet of round 1 chain 1 2sc in every st slip_stitch 12 sts total round 3 chain 1 1 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times slip_stitch fasten_off white 18 sts total round 4 white attach white at first single_crochet of round 3 chain 1 2 single_crochet 2sc in next st 6 times slip_stitch 24 sts total round 5 chain 1 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times slip_stitch 30 sts total fasten_off here are some photos of the eyeball being worked socket work in brown repeat rounds 1-5 of eyeball part round 6- ch1 4 single_crochet 2sc in next st 6 times slip_stitch 36 sts total round 7- chain 3 counts as 1 double_crochet double_crochet in 35 st around in front loops slip_stitch to chain 3 fasten_off hard to visualize see here straps make 2 round 1- with brown ch6 double_crochet in 3rd st from hook counts as 1st double_crochet 3 double_crochet across chain 2 turn round 2- 3 double_crochet chain 2 turn repeat round 2 until 3 inches long ending with 3dc omit c2 fasten_off finishing sew straps to socket at a slight angle as shown weave in all ends with brown whip stitch eyeball to socket as shown but leave a small opening to stuff slightly with fiberfill sew elastic to both ends of straps and sew buttons in place note that buttons are purely decorative try on patch and enjoy if you make this eyepatch please drop by my blog and let me know http //kellyskraftystuff blogspot com/ ©2008 kelly norman feel free to use this pattern for gift crochet or charity but please refrain from using it for your own personal profit
